metadata.topic_title: Non-Promotion of Personal Services While Serving as Examiner

hierarchy.subdomain: Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct

active_learning.discussion_prompt: As a cybersecurity examiner, you identify vulnerabilities during an audit. The client asks about your personal consulting services to remediate them. Is responding with your business card ethical? Debate the boundaries of independence, using real-world examples like pentest reports or compliance audits, and address misconceptions that minor networking is harmless. Link to standards like (ISC)² Canon 4 and NIST SP 800-53 PS-3.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator specializing in cybersecurity ethics, following university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 20 high-quality flashcards for the topic 'Non-Promotion of Personal Services While Serving as Examiner' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Professional Ethics and Codes of Conduct > Conflict of Interest and Independence > Client and Principal Relationships > Non-Promotion of Personal Services While Serving as Examiner). Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [REMEMBER: Define key terms... CREATE: Formulate guidelines...] Distribute flashcards across objectives. - Active Learning: Use scenarios from discussion prompt, peer teaching examples/non-examples, and problem-solving exercises as flashcard bases. - Scaffolding: 5 flashcards per layer (Foundation: basics; Components: standards; Implementation: application; Integration: advanced). - Research Context: Core concepts (examiner, personal services, COI, objectivity). Standards: NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 (PS-01 Policy/Procedures: https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final; PS-3 Screening: ethics training), (ISC)² Code (Canon 4: https://www.isc2.org/ethics), ISACA Code (https://www.isaca.org/code-of-professional-ethics), OGE 5 CFR 2635 (https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-5/chapter-XVI/subchapter-B/part-2635). Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: - Output as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'references': [...], 'scaffolding_layer': 1, 'bloom_level': 'REMEMBER'}}] - 50% multiple-choice with 4 options (A-D, mark correct), 50% open-ended/short answer. - Distractors: Plausible (misconceptions, edges, similars). - Explanations: Link to objectives/layers/active learning. Ensure completeness, measurable verbs, real-world cybersecurity relevance (audits, pentests).
